name: N-Body Simulator
description:
This simulator was inspired by the n-body problem, an extension to the better known  two and three body problems.  The program does not account for relativity, and simulates celestial motion only using Newton's law of universal gravitation, a classical physics law.  The non-quantitative manner of this simulator intends to bring an intuition to celestial mechanics through an interactive visual, rather than serve as a tool for prediction. 

Controls

  • Pause/Play:  Spacebar 
  • Select Body: Left Click
  • Move Body: (Hold) Left Click
  • Pan View:  W|A|S|D
  • Zoom In/Out: Scroll Wheel
  • Adjust Velocity: (Hold) Right Click
  • Toggle Sidebar: Tab
  • Reset: Backspace

Developer Note

The simulator currently stands as a prototype with known (and unknown) issues. A mouse is recommended for the best experience. The windows download permits N = 50, while the in-browser only permits N = 10.
